summary: R.E.M. was an American rock band formed in 1980 by four university students. They were one of the first alternative rock bands, known for their unique sound and lyrics. The band released their first single in 1981 and gained popularity in the 1990s with albums like "Out of Time" and "Automatic for the People." They achieved mainstream success, selling over 90 million albums worldwide. After some lineup changes, they continued making music until they amicably broke up in 2011. R.E.M. is considered a pioneer in the alternative rock genre.
title: R.E.M.
